summary: This document consists of two emails from defense attorney Christian Everdell to Judge Nathan regarding the filing of a sealed reply memorandum and exhibits in support of Ghislaine Maxwell's renewed bail application in her criminal case. The first email corrects a typographical error in the memorandum, and the second transmits the sealed documents to the court.

events.title: Filing of Revised Bail Motion Reply
events.description: Defense attorney Christian Everdell emails Judge Nathan to submit a corrected, sealed reply memorandum in support of Ghislaine Maxwell's renewed bail application.

events.title: Initial Submission of Sealed Bail Motion Documents
events.description: Defense attorney Christian Everdell emails Judge Nathan to submit under seal the initial reply memorandum and exhibits (A-B) for Maxwell's renewed bail motion.

keyFacts: Ghislaine Maxwell's defense team, led by Christian Everdell of Cohen & Gresser LLP, was actively filing sealed documents in support of a renewed bail motion in December 2020.
The correspondence shows coordination between the defense and the court (Judge Nathan) and indicates the defense also communicated with the government regarding a typographical correction.
The document references the specific criminal case: U.S. v. Ghislaine Maxwell, 20 Cr. 330 (AJN).
The defense team included attorneys Mark S. Cohen, Bobbi C Sternheim, Jeff Pagliuca, and Laura Menninger.
The filings were made under seal pursuant to a court order (Dkt. 89 and Dkt. 101).
